page.title: 20Harrowden Hall near Finedon
page.content:
Harrowden Hall was bought by Thomas Watson Wentworth,Marquess of Rockingham in 1695.The present Hall dates from around 1720 and is a Grade 1 listed building.It is fairly plain in appearance and until fairly recently belonged to the family of Lord Vaux. This Catholic family had connections with the Treshams and the gunpowder plot.A small Catholic Chapel was built in the grounds of the Hall in 1905.It is a copy of a chantry chapel at Higham Ferrers.
With the exception of the chapel the Hall and grounds were bought by the Wellingborough Golf Club in 1975.The parkland around the Hall now provides the setting for an 18 hole 6363 yards 72 par golf course.
